claim: The aggregate bounty associated with posts titled about "data" totals 250.
extra_info: About data means the title contains 'data'; total bounty Amount refers to Sum(BountyAmount)
reasoning: The SUM(BountyAmount) from the votes table for posts whose Title contains 'data' is 250, which exactly matches the claim.

content.text: I'll verify this claim by exploring the database schema and then querying for the relevant data.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

tool_use_result.stdout:
badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: The `posts` table doesn't have a `BountyAmount` column. Let me check the `votes` table, as bounties are often tracked there.

input.description: Check votes table schema for BountyAmount

content.content:
CREATE TABLE votes
(
    Id           INTEGER  not null
        primary key,
    PostId       INTEGER  null,
    VoteTypeId   INTEGER  null,
    CreationDate DATE null,
    UserId       INTEGER  null,
    BountyAmount INTEGER  null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE votes
(
    Id           INTEGER  not null
        primary key,
    PostId       INTEGER  null,
    VoteTypeId   INTEGER  null,
    CreationDate DATE null,
    UserId       INTEGER  null,
    BountyAmount INTEGER  null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: The `BountyAmount` column is in the `votes` table. Now let me query for the total bounty amount for posts with "data" in the title.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT SUM(v.BountyAmount) FROM votes v JOIN posts p ON v.PostId = p.Id WHERE p.Title LIKE '%data%';"
input.description: Sum bounty amount for posts with 'data' in title

content.text:
The query returns exactly **250**, which matches the claim.
